comments.body:
Not sure why it's been working so far:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80257650/118301969-f1120d00-b4e3-11eb-8d4d-028628cc1d3c.png)
And is it still working after this change? ðŸ˜„
I will have to test it e2e from the oem integration kit ðŸ˜„
I think it works, as we do not create any new spans and attributes between this place and next gRPC calls.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +65,69 @@      keyValueSubmission
        .configurationToSubmission(maxRecordTime, submissionId, writer.participantId, config)
    commit(submissionId, submission)
  }

comments.body: I would rather catch the relative contract ids in the transaction encoding. Pretty expensive traversing it just for this.

The objective is to completly get ride of the relative contract id. I would prefer kvutils type does not reference at all relative contract ids and drop support of old contract ids scheme in the sandbox as soon as possible (that is 2/3 releases). 
So we could simply merge `SubmittedTransaction` and `ComittedTransaction` (using only absolute contract id) and get rid of the `assertNoRelCid`

If it is very urgent we can find a work arround to drop completly relative contract ids and still have the sandbox support old scheme (that is `#txId:nodeId`)
sounds good to me. lets keep it and later clean up.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@        submitterInfo,
        transactionMeta,
        transaction.assertNoRelCid(cid => s"Unexpected relative contract id: $cid"),
      )
    val correlationId = nextSubmissionId()
